howl.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: if a dog, wolf, or other animal howls, it makes a long loud sound
howl.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to make a long loud cry because you are unhappy, angry, or in pain, or because you are amused or excited
howl.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Upstairs, one of the twins began to howl  (=cry).
Somewhere, someone was howling in pain.
He makes audiences howl with laughter.
howl.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to shout or demand something angrily
howl.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Republicans have been howling for military intervention.
howl.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: if the wind howls, it makes a loud high sound as it blows
howl.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a long loud sound made by a dog, wolf, or other animal
howl.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a loud cry or shout showing pain, anger, unhappiness etc.
howl.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: This suggestion was greeted with howls of laughter.
He let out a howl of anguish.
howl.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a loud high sound made by the wind blowing
